summary: Both previously-blocking acceptance-criteria inconsistencies were corrected cleanly, and the revisions do not introduce any new truly blocking problems.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Task 1.1 ACs were internally inconsistent about which control characters are targeted vs the provided regex, risking wrong error-code classification and whitespace-test regressions.
previous_issues_status.notes: The plan now explicitly pins the whitespace regex to `/[\t\n\r\f\v ]/` (the exact 6 chars) and defines the control-char set as the complement: `\x00-\x08`, `\x0E-\x1F`, `\x7F`, with regex `/[\x00-\x08\x0E-\x1F\x7F]/`. It also adds a partitioning test ensuring \t/\n/\r/\f/\v map to SAFETY_WHITESPACE while nearby controls map to SAFETY_CONTROL_CHAR, which directly addresses the earlier ambiguity/churn risk.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Task 1.5 AC-1.5.2 used an incorrect hardcoded `'1'.repeat(15)` example and incorrect numeric equivalence, which could keep the test failing depending on MAX_SAFE_MICRO_USD.
previous_issues_status.notes: AC-1.5.2 now derives the test input from the constant (`String(MAX_SAFE_MICRO_USD)`) and adds a just-below-boundary test (`String(MAX_SAFE_MICRO_USD - 1n)`), making the expectation CI-verifiable and immune to future constant changes.
